commits.message: Add initial peer discovery to peer thread
Cleanup miner and peer thread interface and add basic peer thread logic
Move difficulty check to another file
Turn main loop into a smoke test

issue.title: Add basic peer to peer functionality

comment.body:
> > One more general comment. I didn't see the client side of peering (I.e pinging all ips looking for initial peers)? Did I miss that somewhere and if so can you point it out?
> 
> So this was actually supposed to be a WIP, I thought if I didn't tag you as a reviewer you wouldn't get notifications about it :P
> 
> I'll close this since you've already reviewed it, and I'll mark the WIPs better in the future.

Ah gotcha.  Just thought I should keep up with everything at the very least so I might as review when I have time. :)

commits.message: Clean up dependency injection on server

Merge pull request #8 from ErisMik/peer-2-peer

Add basic peer to peer functionality
Truncate data field to speed up RESTs
Move chain read methods to a unique view class
Add peers endpoint and test peers queue
Add peers list and endpoints for that

Merge pull request #8 from ErisMik/peer-2-peer

comment.body:
> One more general comment. I didn't see the client side of peering (I.e pinging all ips looking for initial peers)? Did I miss that somewhere and if so can you point it out?

So this was actually supposed to be a WIP, I thought if I didn't tag you as a reviewer you wouldn't get notifications about it :P

I'll close this since you've already reviewed it, and I'll mark the WIPs better in the future.
We might, and it's already in there: `std::vector<Bloock> getChain(const std::string& filename)`

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,27 @@
+#pragma once
+
+#include <oatpp/core/macro/codegen.hpp>
+#include <oatpp/parser/json/mapping/ObjectMapper.hpp>
+
+namespace bookchain::http {
+
+/* Begin DTO code-generation */
+#include OATPP_CODEGEN_BEGIN(DTO)
+
+class PeerLinkDto : public oatpp::data::mapping::type::Object {
comment.body: One is for linking one is the actual data. So the PeerLinkDto will be used to syncing up /linking two nodes, whereas the PeerDto represents an actual peer object and is used to transmit peer data (for the whole peers list)
